III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A foster youth went AWOL in April of 2025. Youth was eventually
located and brought to a MDHHS. The youth was given a gift card,
and they later realized the amount on the gift card was incorrect,
so they went back to get the full amount. The youth and the foster
care supervisor were in a verbal altercation over the money, and
the supervisor pinched the youth under her left armpit, causing an
injury, that bled. The youth then slapped the supervisor across the
face. The youth still has a healing mark where they were pinched.
The specific date that this occurred is not known, but it was in
April.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Youth A was interviewed by phone on 5/9/2025. DCWL
Consultant 1 was present in-person with Youth A during the
interview. Youth A reported that approximately a month ago she
returned from AWOL and was at the agency office with Foster
Care Supervisor. She stated Foster Care Supervisor gave her a
gift card and told her it had $25 or $30 on it so Youth A could go
out to lunch. She stated she went out to lunch at a Hibachi
restaurant with a lady she wasn’t able to identify and another 16-
year-old girl. When she swiped the gift card to pay there was no
balance on the card so the lady she was with had to pay. Youth A
stated they all went back to the agency office and the lady
confronted Foster Care Supervisor about there being no money
on the gift card. Foster Care Supervisor stated Youth A was lying
and must have spent the gift card before going out to lunch. Youth
A stated she told Foster Care Supervisor, if she kept “lying on
her,” she would slap her. Youth A stated Foster Care Supervisor
2

pinched Youth A under her arm, so Youth A slapped her across
the face. Youth A stated no one was around to see the pinch or
slap.
DCWL Consultant 1 was spoken to by phone while onsite with
Youth A on 5/9/2025. She was shown a mark on Youth A’s arm by
Youth A which DCWL Consultant described as appearing to be a
healed burn or scar, but did not look like a pinch mark. DCWL
Consultant 1 took a picture of the mark.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed by video conferencing
on 6/12/2025. She reported remembering Youth A coming to the
office after returning from AWOL. Foster Care Supervisor gave
her a gift card so she could go out to lunch with another worker
and youth. When Youth A returned from lunch Foster Care
Supervisor and Foster Care Worker were trying to get her to go to
a shelter, but she was refusing. Foster Care Supervisor stated
they were in the office until 7:00pm until Youth A finally agreed to
go to the shelter. Foster Care Supervisor stated Licensing Worker
1 and Licensing Worker 2 volunteered to drive Youth A to the
shelter; however, Youth A left the office and had someone pick
her, going AWOL again. Foster Care Supervisor stated Youth A
never said anything to her about the gift card not having enough
money for lunch and there was no verbal altercation. She stated
Youth A is a nice girl and never yelled at Foster Care Supervisor.
She reported Youth A never slapped her and even when she was
upset about going to shelter, she just cried and always spoke
respectfully to Foster Care Supervisor. She reported Youth A is
currently upset with her because she was going to go to an
independent living placement, but during a meeting, Foster Care
Supervisor stated she was not ready to live independently
because she was not taking her psychotropic medication. Foster
Care Supervisor stated her job is to keep youth’s safe, not to put
them in a living situation they are not ready for. That is the only
reason she can think of why Youth A would make this allegation.
Section Manager was interviewed by video conferencing on
6/13/2025. She reported being Foster Care Supervisor’s direct
supervisor and was told about the allegation by an agency
licensing supervisor. She stated Licensing Worker 3 had visited
Youth A at her placement and told Licensing Worker 3 that Foster
Care Supervisor had grabbed her by the arm during an altercation
about a gift card. Section Manager stated she was on the phone
with Foster Care Supervisor that day while they were trying to find
placement for Youth A. She stated she never heard any
altercation. She has since spoken with Foster Care Supervisor
3

about the allegation and Foster Care Supervisor denied there
being any altercation with Youth A. Section Manager stated she
has no concerns with Foster Care Supervisor’s character or ability
to perform the functions of her job.
Licensing Worker 1 responded to an email request for an
interview on 6/13/2025 stating she was on her way to the office to
transport Youth A to her placement, but Youth A was already
AWOL when Licensing Worker 1 arrived, so she never saw or
spoke to Youth A. She stated no one at the office said anything
about any altercation having occurred prior to her arrival.
Licensing Worker 2 was interviewed by video conferencing on
6/17/2025. She reported she volunteered to drive Youth A to
shelter that was three hours away. When Licensing Worker 2
arrived at the office Foster Care Supervisor was at her desk.
Licensing Worker went to Foster Care Supervisor for instructions
and to get Youth A’s medications. Licensing Worker 2 stated the
only interaction she saw between Foster Care Supervisor and
Youth A was Foster Care Supervisor telling Youth A she was
going to the shelter and Youth A crying. Licensing Worker 2 stated
Youth A said she wanted to go anywhere but that shelter so
Foster Care Supervisor was asking Youth A if she could think of
anyone with whom she might be able to live. Licensing Worker 2
stated Foster Care Supervisor never even got close to Youth A,
physically. She stated neither Foster Care Supervisor nor Youth A
said anything about a verbal or physical altercation having taken
place. Licensing Worker 2 stated Foster Care Supervisor does not
have the demeanor to pinch a youth, and she was very calm with
Youth A throughout their interaction.
Licensing Worker 3 was interviewed by video conferencing on
6/16/2025. She reported meeting with Youth A at her placement to
discuss a special evaluation on a foster home in which Youth A
previously lived. During that meeting, Youth A brought up that
Foster Care Supervisor had pinched her and drawn blood, so she
slapped Foster Care Supervisor in response. She stated Youth A
reported having been at the office after returning from AWOL and
Foster Care Supervisor gave her gift card with $25 or $50 for food,
but the card only had $5 on it. Youth A asked Foster Care
Supervisor about it and Foster Care Supervisor pinched her under
arm causing her to bleed. Youth A told Licensing Worker 3 this
happened when the office was closed, and no one was around to
see it. Youth A showed Licensing Supervisor a mark under her
left arm near her armpit that looked like a small keloid.
4

Foster Care Worker was on medical leave and unavailable for
interview.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
Photo taken by DCWL Consultant 1 on 5/9/2025 of a raised mark
on the underside of Youth A’s left arm near her armpit. The mark
consisted of a straight line of round raised flesh colored skin. The
mark is tapered toward Youth A’s body.
Analysis A violation has not been established as the interviews conducted
do not support the allegation of Foster Care Supervisor not
demonstrating the character or ability to provide for the needs of
children and families served by the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
June 27, 2025
______________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
